fields.description:
If you create a new build or edit it from the icon on the right you have the options of 

The Trunk
A Branch

However if you veiw the build config then edit the cvs section on it's own you get

HEAD
Branch/Tag


I vote for consistency, and personally prefer head over trunk. Branch/Tag is fine

ps You need to add a 'cosmetic' issue type
fields.summary: cvs branch/head consistency

fields.description: More and more people are actually using Bamboo and need to upgrade. We need to create a step by step guide to show them how this can be done
fields.summary: Create upgrade guide for Bamboo

fields.description:
i give it the exact same details as before (rather it just upgraded but that doesn't seem to currently be working) and it says it fails to validate (error:null).

It's a direct copy of what it was before, that worked. No idea. I can debug but sadly one of my builds is now dead withouth history...
fields.summary: failed to validate build

fields.description:
error during build config give this at the bottom:

Bamboo has failed to validate this build. Please report this error on our (issue tracking) system

    * Failed to validate build: null 

link goes to http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM/

need to remove the end '/' or it won't link correctly
fields.summary: link error to jira

This is moving from a working 0.4 to a new release 0.4 (released thurs)
fields.summary: Tried extracting new zip over old one - error on boot of batch file

fields.description: A 'Save' button on every Page so save minor edits would be Great!
fields.summary: Save functionality on every Page of Wizard

fields.description:
Currently Bamboo has a Dashboard which displays build summary irrespective of weather the user has logged in or not.

This should be configurable via the Admin Page if the dashboard should be displayed or not for guest users.

Also there should be a Panel in RED informing the user that they have not logged in above the Dashboard.
fields.summary: Configurable Permissions for Dashboard

fields.description:
Ability to associate cetain admin users with certains projects.
This will bring into play a super-admin-user who will be able to configure all the users.

Similarly Builds can be configured to be viewed by a restricted set of users. 

In a software services company. You many not want clients to see builds of other projects
fields.summary: Permissions for User and Groups

fields.description:
Currently multiple goals can be specified by seprating them by a blank space.
However for a Build, I need to execute some goals only once.
In such a case. There should be multiple goals with only 1 goal active at a time.

For example, using maven 2  we want to use the 'package' goal to compile and jar the project. However after a production relase I want to all run the 'deploy' goal and install the jar in the Remote Repository.

Currently I have to create a new Build or modify the existing build to do this.
fields.summary: Multiple Goals per Build
Changing context path seems to cause installation to fail

fields.description: The current build summary screen is a little limited and should be updated to include useful telemetry data.
fields.summary: Build Summary Page improvements

fields.description: Not of the eating kind. This will allow us better navigation between pages
fields.summary: Bread Crumbs

fields.description: Having rebuilt the bamboo folder structure for 0.4, the  /bamboo/WEB-INF/classes/bamboo-init.properties is no longer valid - it's in the webapp folder instead.
fields.summary: properties file location incorrect

fields.description:
Started suddenly getting :

2006-09-19 16:41:39,546 ERROR [BJ::BuildPipeline::BuildExecutor] [AntXmlTestResultsParser] Failed to parse xml test results
java.lang.NullPointerException

This is due to an error on running the tests (testcase compiled to wrong java version). The xml to me looks fine...

I'll attach a copy of one if you make this entry private (unless you've already fixed it)
fields.summary: Ant xml files can't be read

fields.description:
Not sure how to mark this one up. If i kill a build partway (say my 2hour build is cut at about 10 mins) it says it's successful. This wouldn't be a problem if it then meant the build queue timer was then updated to include this, thus becoming miles out of what it should be.

I'd like it be marked with something like suspended, or not all tests run - kinda like a 3-state boolean :).

Actually this is quite open. Personally I'd say a build stopped short is a failure as you can't prove your code works unless you run the entire suite. Thus it should be marked as a failure. However, I may be narrow-minded in this thinking....
fields.summary: Cancelling a build part way is marked as a successful build

fields.description:
Haven't got 0.4 working off your site yet - the zip files corrupted. When all our tests fail (and it knows - the logs show it coming up with :

[junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec

) it says 'No tests found!'

I think this is wrong...
fields.summary: when all tests fail, message says no tests found

fields.description:
If I'm not mistaken this is showing up in US format - 10/5/06 is mm/dd/yy? Should really be consistent - build details show up as dd/mm/yyyy so this would be more useful - it's also then in UK format :). 

Mainly for conformity across the entire application the date format should be the same or configurable.
fields.summary: Support period date in incorrect format

fields.description:
Not sure how this would work, but it would definitely be cool. You'd need to read the POM and the POMs of other projects and relate them.

Also, dependencies should be at the project level, rather than the build level, once you introduce this split.
fields.summary: Determine dependencies from Maven

fields.description:
Currently the 'code changes' section of this page is useless. It doesn't tell me which code change caused the failure, and it doesn't tell me even which build to look at for the code change.

In short, if a dependent build breaks, you have no idea what or who caused it.

http://panda.sydney.atlassian.com:8080/functestbamboo/build/viewBuildResults.action?buildNumber=653&buildKey=CONFRPC

You need to include details of the dependent build somewhere. Definitely in this code changes section, probably in other places as well.
fields.summary: Link dependent builds to the build which launched them

fields.description:
At present, the build queue timer is on the main home page. It would be nice if it was shown also on the viewBuildSummary.action page as well during building.... Alternatively adding it to the build summary table as another section would be kinda cool but not necessary :) 

Personally, the bamboo instance we have only has one build on it so not sure what the build queue timer would look like for multiple projects
fields.summary: build timer on project screen

fields.description:
not sure how practical this would be, but sometimes my build fails for non build related issues (the box it's on is windows so anything's possible). I know one of my builds takes an average of 120mins, however two builds failed within 10 mins, so the average has dropped to 60 mins. I'd rather it didn't. 

clearly the build timer is a bonus anyway, so it's not too much of a problem, but it would be nice
fields.summary: Ability to ignore builds from average time calc

fields.description: Support for AccuRev as a source control repository!
fields.summary: AccuRev as a supported repository

fields.description: Validation doesn't quite work as when setting the field (e.g. cvs module), a preliminary validation occurs (e.g. in the method updateAndDetectIfRepositoryHasChanged) and this returns the original value if the new value is empty. Hence it passes the validation code later on which does spit out the error message.
fields.summary: Validation not working for edit configuration of build definitions

fields.description:
cvs password is optional. it says so. if you leave it blank on creating the project it doesn't mind. However, if you go back to it later and edit the repository data (updateBuildRepository.action) and then try to save, it says 'repository.cvs.password.required'... but it's optional....

Think there's a check there that doesn't need to be :)
fields.summary: Optional field appears to be mandatory on update (cvs password)

fields.description: As Bamboo is Beetlejuice reskinned (plus some), it seems odd (maybe I missed it) that there is no current upgrade option to take current beetlejuice setup's and convert them over to the new bamboo setup. I'd imaging this hinderance to the beetlejuice community (if I haven't missed the option - i'll keep looking but there was nothing in the new install) is unnecessary. Will raise a bug relating the the actual error shortly.
fields.summary: Upgrade option from beetlejuice

fields.description:
Currently says:

This page shows the latest <number> most recent activity log entries for the cat tools build. Logs refreshes every <number> seconds.

latest most recent? Would seem that 'most recent' is not necessary here.
fields.summary: Grammer on Log page

fields.description:
I would prefer that if I asked a log page to refresh every 10 seconds, when I went back to it or any other log page, they also had their refresh times set to 10seconds

Whether this is maintained per user (being a web app i'm aware that's an issue) or just per session (probably easier) is not a problem. Personally if i leave the app and go back to it I don't mind as much if the refresh is reset. Or in a pointless options style, you could add it to the user preferences screen :s (it's an option, not a suggestion)
fields.summary: Keep refresh option for logs

fields.description:
This page doesn't refresh. Thus, if a build finishes, you think it's still running until you leave the page, even if the refreshed log file says it has.

Page name - viewBuildActivityLog.action
fields.summary: Log page refreshing

fields.description:
I created a build specifying jdk 1.5. This failed, so I added a 1.4 jdk to bamboo then changed the build to use 1.4. However the logs show that it continues to use the original 1.5 jdk, even after a restart of the app.

This is backed by the fact that I then removed the 1.5 jdk from bamboo completely, and it still builds using 1.5.

Addition: It seems that it is actually using a different jdk to run the ant script, which was never even specified in the admin screen. This is not even the JAVA_HOME value on the server
fields.summary: Doesn't change jdk after creation

fields.description:
When viewing an individual build's screen, you generally see a grid with status, name, build count and operations. this screen regularly refreshes to update the status. However, when it refreshes, sometimes (more often than not, but not everytime) the grid won't refresh properly, so some of the edges don't show up. 

Page is viewBuildSummary.action?buildKey=XXX
fields.summary: Build table doesn't always refresh correctly

fields.description: Need to add the r1 and r2 properties to make sure FishEye also finds the diff
fields.summary: WebUrl link should link to the diff of the file

fields.description:
Bamboo is a multi-threaded app and I don't doubt we'll run into some issues with this sooner or later.

We should implement the Thread debugging page as per http://www.javaspecialists.co.za/archive/newsletter.do?issue=132&locale=en_US

Since this will require Java 5, we also need to create a special module which will house code that requires Java 5. Any code that requires Java 5 needs to be behave defensively, so that I will still run under 1.4 (gives nice error messages)
fields.summary: Add ThreadDump page for debugging client problems

fields.description: Errors appearing in the error log are associated with a build project, but they are not associated with a particular build or timestamp. It would be good to know whether they were the cause or result of some particular build failure...
fields.summary: Error Log needs more context eg. build no, timestamp.

fields.description:
When I add Visual Studio 2003 to the builder list with a long commandline, it puts extraneous quotes around everything which causes the IDE to launch on the remote build machine, locking up the build until I log in and close the IDE. The build script says it is doing this:

 ... running command line: ""c:\program files\Microsoft Visual Studio .NET 2003\Common7\IDE\devenv.com" '"C:\localdev\DotNet\Source\DataAccess\DataAccess.sln /rebuild Release /project DataAccessInstaller"'"

All the quotes around the second part of this commandline shouldn't be there, or we should be given the opportunity to leave them out. My paramaters for the builder and project in question have no quotes, so it looks like Bamboo is adding all of them itself. This commandline would work in this case:

"c:\program files\Microsoft Visual Studio .NET 2003\Common7\IDE\devenv.com" C:\localdev\DotNet\Source\DataAccess\DataAccess.sln /rebuild Release /project DataAccessInstaller
fields.summary: Adding VisualStudio as builder launches IDE when built
Create new BuildReason object which can pass along more information for dependency builds.

fields.description: Lucene indexing required to support faster retrieval of information.
fields.summary: Implement Lucene for indexing of data
Create Current Building Page
Create Commit Page
Create Author Pages

fields.description:
The mail being sent out has a count of "authors". This is actually the number of commits.

This should be fixed to be the number of unique authors
fields.summary: Mail template reporting wrong authors count

fields.description: artifacts with same label overwrite each other
fields.summary: Add validation when adding artifacts

fields.description:
I think making the boxes consistent heights would make the UI look 100% better on the configuration screen. An inconsistent and jagged layout is the underlying problem; there may be ways to achieve it other than with the heights.

You could use this balanced column javascript:

http://www.paulbellows.com/getsmart/balance_columns/

See attached images for an example. (CSS hackery only let me use one height for all four, instead of two separate values. JS should allow this.)
fields.summary: Make floatingPanel heights consistent across rows on Configuration screen

fields.description: Clicking through from the 'download/allbuilds/rss/' directory fails. (rss directory is repeated twice for the files in the folder)
fields.summary: Directory Listing URLs are stuffed

fields.description: Should link to first failing build (if not current build) and show how many builds / time it's been failing for
fields.summary: Add a failing since link on Build Summary page

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to have a developer say thay are taking responsibility for fixing a broken build, so that other members of the team know that someone is looking at the problem (like Jetbrains Team City)
fields.summary: Enable team member to take responsibility for a broken build
General Configuration, Build Expiry --> change to view and edit screens instead of just edit screen
Delete a Project screen always checks the first project when clicking.

fields.description: Makes it easier to diagnose problems
fields.summary: Fix up footer to include the date that the build was made as well as the build number

fields.description:
The IM Server and the Mail Server only has an Edit screen at the moment. This is a little confusing, since after the edit, there's no where for the user to be redirected to.

It's also more user friendly to always have the View -> Edit screens available for any component
fields.summary: View Screens for Mail Server and IM Server

fields.description:
As part of BAM-113, we had to remove code supporting the Java Service Wrapper (http://wrapper.tanukisoftware.org/doc/english/introduction.html) which provides some pretty useful reliablility benefits.

We should try to get this reintegrated with the installer version of Bamboo for the next release.
fields.summary: Reimplement Java Service Wrapper to be bundled as part of the standard installer
IM Server passwords in plaintext
Add new screens and improve existing screen to improve overall information delivery
Passwords are displayed in plaintext

fields.description: Change all passwords such that they are not displayed in plaintext
fields.summary: Passwords in plaintext

fields.description:
Ensure the second sentence at the top of the build log page uses correct grammar, capitalisation and also makes sense for all values of the drop down.

1. Fix "Logs refreshes" to be "Log refreshes".
2. Change the drop down to have the options:
- never
- every 5 seconds
- every 30 seconds

Fewer options would be better too. Do I really need to choose between 1, 3 and 5 second refreshes? Who is on a network where the page loads that fast anyway?

With this screen, I'm always interested in what is happening at the bottom and need to scroll down. Could we have a link at the top to jump to the bottom? Could it do this automatically, and put the options at the bottom? (Maybe this pushes you too far from the menu bar, though. Especially on auto-refresh.)

I use this page a lot, so it would be good to improve it!
fields.summary: Fix grammar on build log screen

fields.description:
In controlfooter-core.ftl
it has
doesLabelKeyHaveMatchingDescription(parameters.labelKey)
which raises log4j warnings when there is no labelkey with matching labelkey description
fields.summary: Can't find i18n key blah.description

fields.description:
The installation directory of Bamboo should be improved and the contents of the distributions revisited:

- Use a cleaner directory structure and create a webp-app directory.
- Revisit and select appropriate distributions and their relevant launchers.
- Include repository trigger scripts in distribution.
- Rename "bamboo-server" to "startup".
- Include other useful batches (install-as-service, etc.)
fields.summary: Distributions have confusing directory structure.

fields.description: Once you startup the server, and goto http://localhost:8085 it shows you that your environment is not setup correctly. I had to create the file WEB-INF/classes/bambo-init.properties and guess that I had to have a property called "bambo.home"
fields.summary: Installation fails to locate bambo-init.properties file for bambo home directory

fields.description: Can you please add Borland StarTeam as a supported repository?
fields.summary: Add Borland StarTeam as a supported repository

fields.description:
While debugging our cluster build, it would be great to have an option to just build the project manually.

At the moment, the build can only be a CVS trigger or polling for changes. This means the always-broken build gets kicked off frequently, taking space in the queue and CPU when other builds could be running.
fields.summary: Add 'change detection' option for manual build only

fields.description:
I get IM messages at home, but then can't check the build results without a tunnel to the office.

Now we have security the instance can be public, yes?
fields.summary: Set up bamboo.atlassian.com

fields.description:
Seconds might still be useful when max build time for the graph is less than a minute, but for builds that take upwards of 1 minute I think a scale of minutes looks much better.

Large numbers take up more space and seconds->minutes conversion is non-metric therefore difficult to do mentally.
fields.summary: Build time graph should use minutes in scale

fields.description: Currently, the quartz Scheduler is manually started and maintained in the BambooContainer itself. We should investigate how Quartz can be used inside Spirng (e.g. http://www.springframework.org/docs/reference/scheduling.html) and migrate to that way instead
fields.summary: Update Quartz usage to utilise Spring

fields.description:
{{com.atlassian.bamboo.container.ShutdownHook}} isn't able to access the projects to ensure that builds are shutdown nicely.

Not 100% what the problem is. Will need to investigate the proper way this is meant to work
fields.summary: ShutdownHook doesn't work correctly in Tomcat

fields.description: Allows builds to be grouped withing a project and persist everything on the database level
fields.summary: Introduce Project -> Build Definition concept

fields.description:
The Zen forest page has a bug when constructing the links to the project. It adds an extra slash to the link.

See link for "Confluence Mvn2 Functional Tests" under Cold server
fields.summary: double slash ( "\\") in link

fields.description: Bad things happen when deleting builders with dependent projects.
fields.summary: Disallow deleting builders with dependent projects

fields.description:
adding and editing builders may fail if bamboo is not deployed to a environment without a empty context path

context path is repeated if it is not empty
fields.summary: Context Path duplicated when submitting add/edit row in builders

fields.description: When there are no builders configured, the row which allows adding new builders in the builders table disappears.
fields.summary: Can't add builder when there are no builders

fields.description:
When a file is commited to the CVS repository then it triggers the projects that are using that CVS to build.
This causes a problem when there are several projects for the one CVS. This is because some of these projects are known to be unstable and likely fail.
Therefore if there is a way to temporary diable these project builds it would reduce the number of projects in the queue.
So more time can be spent on building useful projects.
fields.summary: Option to disable projects

fields.description:
This error is raised

"Cannot send build results email, the email server has not been configured. "

even when a project settings specify that no emails need to be sent
fields.summary: attempts to email even when email not selected

fields.description: The link for queued projects currently points to an invalid location. This should be  {http://panda.sydney.atlassian.com:8080/functestbamboo/project/viewProjectSummary.action?projectKey=BAMFUNC} but is  {http://panda.sydney.atlassian.com:8080/functestbamboo/viewProjectSummary.action?projectKey=BAMFUNC}

Some validations are initially not loaded when creating users and groups - this happens when the server is initially setup.

Restarting the server provides a temporary workaround

Change the time of the build log to 24 Hour time instead of just 12 Hour with no am/pm to show when it was run
eg.
 17-Aug-2006 05:45:55  	[surefire] Running com.atlassian.confluence.SiteImportAcceptanceTest
                           ^ ----------5am or 5 pm???

fields.description:
Currently, we are only able to delete all files within the 'Project Build Files' section

We want to be able to delete selected files. Can you please implement a checkbox function to allow for that?

Tony.
fields.summary: Checkbox for deleting build files

Make sure we write unit tests to prove the bug and then fix it.

fields.description:
We should make sure that the module can be checked out.

h3. Implementation Notes

Validator shold checkout *only the top level files* to a tmp directory using the provided credentials
fields.summary: CVS Repo should validate its module

fields.description:
Exception:weblogic.management.ApplicationException: activate failed for atlassian-bamboo-web-app-0.1 Module: atlassian-bamboo-web-app-0.1 Error: weblogic.management.DeploymentException: - with nested exception: [java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: com/atlassian/bamboo/setup/BootstrapLoaderListener (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0)] java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: com/atlassian/bamboo/setup/BootstrapLoaderListener (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Ljava.lang.String;[BIILjava.security.ProtectionDomain;)Ljava.lang.Class;(Unknown Source) at

Comment from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Getting+Started+with+Bamboo

> Which requirements has Bamboo? JSE version and/or JEE version?

Bamboo should be compatible with any server that supports Servlet API 2.2 and JDK 1.4, although we've tested the application primarily on JDK 1.5 at the moment.

Hence Bamboo 0.1 isn't running on Java 1.4 right now or I'm missing something.
fields.summary: UnsupportedClassVersionError deploying Bamboo on BEA WLS 8.1 SP 4

* Forget Password is a button. Should just be a link
* Should have a signup link

fields.description: Jabber server details needs to be pulled out of the standard project editing cycle
fields.summary: IM Server details should be shareable

fields.description:
I got the following message via Jabber:

[13:50] Bamboo: Confluence (Tomcat, Postgres, Cluster) build 68 has FAILED (519 tests failed, 1 failures were new) : Change made by cmiller
http://panda.sydney.atlassian.com:8080/functestbamboo/viewBuildResults.action?buildNumber=68&projectKey=CONFTPC

Clicking on the link shows that 19 failures were new. Looks like the Jabber message is counting something different to the Bamboo web site.
fields.summary: New build failures count in Jabber message is different to web site

fields.description:
If an exception is thrown during building, then it is caught and the Thread returns.

This results in the Build just hanging there and having to be killed manually
fields.summary: Buid hangs if exception is thrown during build

fields.description: Deleting build queues work.... until you restart the server, then the build queues that you deleted mysteriously reappear.
fields.summary: Deleting build queues don't work

fields.description:
I was trying to set up project dependencies for the JIRA dependant projects. For the JIRA Toolkit I created dependencies to JIRA, atlassian-renderer etc. The build did not trigger when JIRA was built, and wouldn't build manually either, even after a restart. Only solution was to remove dependencies, then manually rebuild.

The dependencies feature would be particularly useful for us as we have a significant number of dependant projects that we want to setup on both the branch and head builds of JIRA, as well as common projects (like renderer) that both JIRA and Confluence depend on.
fields.summary: Project dependencies don't work

fields.description:
Mysterious bug where a project appears in two different build queues (i.e. building more than once).

Not sure how to reproduce this problem.
fields.summary: Project added to build queue more than once

fields.description: Currently there are no cache-control headers on the static resources (images, css etc.), so they are being downloaded every page refresh (every 10 secs). The forest page downloads 250k every time. Causes annoying visual flicker as well as increased network traffic.
fields.summary: Static files are not cached, increases size of downloads

fields.description: Currently if there are some big builds in progress that consume 100% CPU, the webapp becomes entirely unresponsive. We need a xplatform way to lower the priority of the build processes so they do not interfere with the UI.
fields.summary: Lower priority of spawned build processes

fields.description: Pinch the 500 and 404 pages from Confluence / JIRA to offer a more descriptive error page
fields.summary: Add decent 404 and 500 pages

fields.description:
Specifying the SMTP server doesn't actually do anything except save it to the DB in Bamboo

localhost is used in all instances.

Note that keg emails correctly using its own smtp server.
fields.summary: SMTP server cannot be specified
